snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio is facing questions about favoritism and undue influence after he called a police official to inquire about the arrest of a Brooklyn bishop, a key political supporter.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio is facing questions about favoritism and undue influence after information emerges that he called high-ranking police official to inquire about arrest of Bishop Orlando Findlayter of Brooklyn, who is key political supporter; both Police Dept and City Hall say mayor did not request any special treatment for the pastor, who had been arrested for a traffic violation.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio is facing questions about favoritism and undue influence after he called a police official to inquire about the arrest of a Brooklyn bishop, a key political supporter.

headline.main: Debate Over de Blasio Call on Bishop’s Arrest
headline.print_headline: Inquiry Into Arrest of Ally Stirs Debate on Mayor’s Judgment
